hours._text:
Monday: 2pm to 5pm Warm Hub (visitors can read, use the internet, talk, and have tea and coffee). Older men can also join Franks Club at the same time.
Tuesday: 9.30am to 2pm Warm Hub (visitors can read, use the internet, talk, and have tea and coffee). 2pm to 4pm Forget-Me-Nots for older people who want to maintain their memory.
Wednesday: 9.30am to 1pm Warm Hub (visitors can read, use the internet, talk, and have tea and coffee). 1.30pm to 3.30pm (older people are welcome to join in with arts and crafts social activities).
Thursday: 9.30am to 4pm (any older person is welcome to join in with positive ageing activities.
Friday: 9.30am to 4pm (any older person with vision impairment is welcome to join in with our regular Crusoe Club activities, with a two-course lunch for £6).

title: Blackfriars Settlement

hours._text: Our Carers Café will be open every Friday for cared-for residents of Southwark. The café will offer food, a filling meal including a dessert, and non-alcoholic drinks, teas coffees and squash. The café will also offer entertainment in the form of music, dancing, films, and creative craft sessions, depending on attendees' interests. Attendees will also have access to our vast library of books, that are available to borrow.

hours._text:
Open every Friday 1pm to 3pm.
Link Age Southwark, in partnership with the United Reformed Church (URC), will be offering a free hot lunch and afternoon social session. Lunch will be provided by the URC and will consist of home-made soup and a bread roll. There will also be board games and activities available for local residents aged over 60 and those with a diagnosis of dementia. Family members and carers are also welcome to attend with the person they support.

Opening times

  • 21 November 2022 (12 noon onwards)
  • 12 December 2022 (12 noon onwards)
  • 19 December 2022 (12 noon onwards)

The Dragon Café brings people together to join in creative activities such as creative writing sessions, a singing group, poetry, drawing, mindful meditation, and a dance group. The emphasis of these activities is always to have fun and to feel connected to other members of the community. These events also provide much needed connection with peers and an opportunity to socialise and will provide free food for those who attend.
